https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/XtF3xIHueNSFuTCwmkQg8rLa4G.jpg Three Miniature, Illuminated, Heliographic studies of plants, observed and imagined. Fragile leaves and very fine threads of fungus string together in Charlotte Pryceâ€™s three plant studies. Plants and images of the plants, and their envisioned environments, are intertwined. The title is taken from an obscure genre of 17th century painting: Forest Floor Paintings, which placed plants into a 'real' environment as opposed to a vase. Discoveries on the Forest Floor 1-3
